title: Chinese Tea Eggs Recipe
description: Chinese tea eggs are boiled eggs steeped in a savory black tea with star anise, cinnamon, and tangerine zest for a beautiful marbled surface and soft yolk.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Chinese Tea Eggs 4.7 (30) 27 Reviews 7 Photos These tea eggs are one of my favorite dishes and traditional lucky food to make for the Lunar New Year. The hard-boiled eggs are subtly flavored with anise and have a deep brown hue from black tea and soy. The marbled patterns from the cracked shells make these quite attractive. Recipe courtesy of Mom. Submitted by soygirl Updated on January 16, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 3 hrs Additional Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 11 hrs 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 tea eggs Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 cups water 2 tablespoons black tea leaves 1 tablespoon soy sauce 1 tablespoon black soy sauce 1 tablespoon tangerine zest 1 (2-inch) piece cinnamon stick 2 pods star anise 1 ¼ teaspoons salt, divided 8 large eggs Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes /Qi Ai Combine 3 cups water, tea leaves, soy sauce, black soy sauce, zest, cinnamon stick, star anise, and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 3 hours. Allrecipes /Qi Ai Meanwhile, place eggs and remaining 1 teaspoon salt into a medium pot; cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes. Allrecipes /Qi Ai Remove from heat, drain, and cool. Tap cooled eggs with the back of a spoon to crack shells; do not remove shells. Allrecipes /Qi Ai Remove the saucepan from the heat. Add eggs and let steep for at least 8 hours, or for a richer flavor, up to 1 ½ days. Allrecipes /Qi Ai Cook’s Note I eat these chilled and quartered as a side dish, appetizer, or snack. Store unpeeled eggs in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator for four to five days.  I Made It Print 62 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chinese Tea Eggs 01 of 07 Photo by  Allrecipes /Qi Ai 02 of 07 Photo by  LovesCooking 01/13/2025 Crowd-pleaser A keeper! I was looking for a recipe for my Lunar New Year platter and I think I’ve hit jackpot. These look astonishing with their fascinating colors and patterns. They also taste amazing, umami and slightly sweet, a crowd pleaser all the way. Bookmarking this recipe for sure. 03 of 07 Photo by  Cristina Danielle 03/23/2015 I love these eggs! I used to eat one every morning when I lived in China! This recipe is a good one, but I'm finding it hard to recreate the exact flavor of the eggs. I also didn't use the black soy sauce because I couldn't find it anywhere, but i added in some sugar to counteract the saltiness of the recipe. Although I didn't actually think they were as salty as some people seemed to think. I'm made these twice now and I will definitely continue to make them in the future. They are a nice change from regular hard boiled eggs. Now all I need is some pickled bamboo and rice porridge and I'll be back in China! 04 of 07 Photo by  Cristina Danielle 03/23/2015 I love these eggs! They are a nice change from regular hard boiled eggs. Now all I need is some pickled bamboo and rice porridge and I'll be back in China! 07 of 07 Photo by  Guy Robert Bastien 01/11/2015 1 You’ll Also Love Tea Leaf Eggs 8 Ratings Chef John's Shrimp Toast 29 Ratings Potstickers (Chinese Dumplings) 98 Ratings Cantonese Style Pork and Shrimp Dumplings 25 Ratings Traditional Pot Stickers 297 Ratings Golden Sesame Balls Perfect Pot Stickers 116 Ratings Pork Dumplings 375 Ratings Jian Bing (Chinese Crêpes) 8 Ratings Sweet and Sour Chicken 1,255 Ratings Slow-Cooked Red Braised Pork Belly 4 Ratings Grandma's Hong Shau Rou (Red Braised Pork) 2 Ratings Crispy Crab Rangoon 145 Ratings Authentic Chinese Egg Rolls (from a Chinese person) 246 Ratings Whitney's Egg Flower Soup 13 Ratings Chinese Chicken Salad 55 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
